snippet: Mr. Lyubimov, who founded the experimental Taganka Theater in Moscow in 1964, led productions that once prompted the Soviet government to send him into exile.
abstract: Yuri Lyubimov, a Russian stage director whose adventurous productions won a devoted following, frequently landed him in trouble with Soviet authorities and eventually led to his exile, but who later returned in triumph and remained a mainstay of Russian theater for more than 20 years, dies at age 97.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Lyubimov, who founded the experimental Taganka Theater in Moscow in 1964, led productions that once prompted the Soviet government to send him into exile.

headline.main: Yuri Lyubimov, Experimental Director of Russian Stage, Dies at 97
headline.print_headline: Yuri Lyubimov, Experimental Director of the Russian Stage, Is Dead at 97
